alert.note: Alert for Bennett; Haakon; Mellette; Northern Jackson; Southern Jackson; Todd; Tripp (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 2:28AM MST until January 12 at 5:00PM MST by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ THIS AFTERNOON TO 11 AM MST /NOON CST/ MONDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST /MIDNIGHT CST/ SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, widespread blowing snow is expected. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Portions of south central and southwestern South Dakota. This includes the Tribal Lands of the Pine Ridge Reservation and the Rosebud Reservation. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 PM MST /6 PM CST/ this afternoon to 11 AM MST /noon CST/ Monday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 8 PM MST /9 PM CST/ this evening to 11 PM MST /midnight CST/ Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Even if you are outdoors for just a few minutes, cover all parts of your body, especially your head, face, and hands. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Road conditions are available on your smartphone from the 5 1 1 app for your state.
